title: Shostakovich Piano Trio No 1 & 2
description:
Dmitry Shostakovich (1906-1975) - Piano Tri No 1 & 2

mp3 160 kbits

Performers:
Piano	Alexander Bonduriansky
Violin	Vladimir Ivanov
Cello	Mikhail Utkin

----------------------------- Tracks ----------------------------------
1, Piano Trio No. 1 in C minor, Op. 8 for Piano, Violin and Cello
2. Piano Trio No. 2 in E minor op 67 for Piano, Violin and Cello Andante - Moderato
3. Piano Trio No. 2 in E minor op 67 for Piano, Violin and Cello Allegro con brio
4. Piano Trio No. 2 in E minor op 67 for Piano, Violin and Cello Largo
5. Piano Trio No. 2 in E minor op 67 for Piano, Violin and Cello Allegretto

Piano Trio No 1 in C minor was created as a student work in 1923 and its last 16 bars were completed later by Shostakovich's pupil, Boris Tishchenko. Alternative solutions have been provided by Leslie Howard and Borys Lyatoshynsky. The one-movement trio was composed in late romantic style with impressionist elements. There are melodic and rhythmic structure changes in several sections.

The Piano Trio No. 2 in E minor, Op. 67, by Dmitri Shostakovich was written in 1944 and dedicated to the memory of his closest friend Ivan Sollertinsky, who had recently died. The work received its premiere in Leningrad on 14 November 1944.
